image.altText: A blurred photo of trucks and a motorhome driving on the Bruce Highway

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's opening gambit for 2025 — a year in which an election is due to be held no later than May 17 — underscores the importance of the nation's northern jurisdictions to the coming contest.

title.children: Albanese unveils $7.2b highway upgrade as election speculation looms

image.altText: Demi Moore smiling holding a Golden Globe.

props.synopsis: The Golden Globes are underway in Los Angeles, with the best in film and television to be crowned. Follow live

title.children: Demi Moore scores first ever award as an actor for The Substance at Golden Globes

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why has Emilia Pérez swept the nominations - and when can Australians watch it?

image.altText: Proxy mum with Alex

props.synopsis: ARFID is a newly recognised eating disorder, which became an official diagnosis for adults and children in 2013. For 12-year-old Alex*, the diagnosis came as a relief after years bouncing around the medical system.

title.children: Eating disorder ARFID is almost as common as anorexia

image.altText: A composite image showing the faces of Elon Musk and Nigel Farage

props.synopsis: The world's richest man, who has forged a political alliance with Donald Trump, says Mr Farage should quit as leader of Britain's right-wing Reform UK Party.

title.children: Elon Musk calls for Reform UK leader Nigel Farage to quit

image.altText: Passengers gather on the tarmac beside an Etihad plane with a yellow fire truck parked beside the wing.

props.synopsis: Passengers praise the calm manner of the captain and crew of an Etihad Airways flight that was forced to abort take-off at Melbourne Airport on Sunday night.

title.children: Passengers describe jolt and 'smoke' during aborted take-off at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo arrive on the red carpet. Ariana wears a yellow/gold dress while Cynthia wears black

props.synopsis: Awards season is kicking off in Los Angeles as the 82nd Golden Globes Awards gets underway, with TV and film stars rocking fancy frocks on the red carpet.

title.children: Golden Globes red carpet: Wicked stars Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo arrive

image.altText: A jockey in yellow red and green rides a brown horse on a race track.

props.synopsis: Damage to a horseracing track on the Gold Coast that has put the Magic Millions' main race under a cloud may have been caused by poison, authorities say.

title.children: Magic Millions track potentially poisoned early last week, police say

image.altText: Yoon Suk Yeol stands behind a podium, speaking into a microphone, with two flags behind him

props.synopsis: South Korea's anti-corruption agency requests police take over efforts to detain impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol.

title.children: Police to take over efforts to detain impeached South Korean president

image.altText: A girl playing in a fountain on a water day

props.synopsis: NSW swelters through a warm evening ahead of a hot day with high fire danger in some parts of the state, but forecasters say a cool change with the chance of rain is likely from tomorrow.

title.children: Sydneysiders swelter through warm night and hot day ahead of cool change

image.altText: Rear view of dad holding her little girl in his arms and looking at their house with installed solar panels.

props.synopsis: An energy-efficient home can save you thousands of dollars in power bills each year, but the initial outlay for solar or batteries is expensive. Luckily, there are a few ways to pay for it.

title.children: Green mortgage clients saving tens of thousands on home loans

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti sprayed on a white car parked in a driveway.

props.synopsis: NSW Police have launched an investigation after anti-Semitic graffiti was tagged on the side of a white car, which was parked on a suburban street in Queens Park.

title.children: 'It is intolerable': Anti-Semitic slur sprayed on car in Sydney's east

image.altText: Russell Crowe with Sam Burgess at the 2014 NRL grand final

props.synopsis: Hollywood actor Russell Crowe denies reports he is looking to sell the 25 per cent stake in the club he purchased in 2006.

title.children: Russell Crowe denies rumours he is selling Rabbitohs stake

image.altText: woman sitting at desk inside her catamaran

props.synopsis: Living aboard a boat has many advantages, offering residents a sense of community, security and a flexible lifestyle. For this reason, some women are giving up their homes on land to live on the water.

title.children: Single, older women are selling their homes to live on boats in marinas

image.altText: man stands in rubble of bombed building

props.synopsis: Israel and Hamas have wrangled over a deal to halt fighting in the Gaza Strip and return hostages home.

title.children: Hamas and Israel wrangle over hostage deal

image.altText: A shell in mid-air, immediately after being launched by a grenade launcher with a soldier behind it, with a field behind him.

props.synopsis: Ukraine has occupied a small part of Russia's Kursk region for the last five months, prompting Moscow to deploy North Korean troops there.

title.children: Ukrainian military stages fresh push in Russian territory

image.altText: Mark White in cockpit of plane

props.synopsis: Local aviation groups have paid tribute to two experienced pilots killed in a plane crashed near a beach on the NSW mid-north coast over the weekend.

title.children: Double tragedy sparks renewed calls for investigation of all fatal aviation crashes

image.altText: Sam Konstas wearing a helmet

props.synopsis: Indian coach Gautam Gambhir does not pull any punches speaking to reporters after seeing his side go down 3-1 to lose the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the first time in a decade.

title.children: India coach says Australians 'can't be that soft' over Konstas sledging

image.altText: Still taken from video filmed by man suspected of New Orleans attack.

props.synopsis: The FBI says the New Orleans terrorist visited the city twice before and recorded video of the French Quarter with hands-free glasses.

title.children: New Orleans terrorist used Meta glasses to record city, FBI says

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: Pride groups say they want more transparency around content moderation from Meta, after the tech giant deleted a string of Facebook posts on their pages.

title.children: Meta blames 'technical error' for removal of pride groups' posts

image.altText: mountains and clouds

props.synopsis: Residents are rejoicing as rain clouds rather than smoke cover the national park mountains and the fire is declared contained after burning out of control for 21 days.

title.children: Grampians National Park bushfire contained as rain brings relief

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 has opened higher this morning after Wall Street shrugged off its festive season torpor for its first significant rally of the year. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX higher after Wall Street rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Despite a bumper year, car sales are stalling as EV sales flatline
ASX only marginally higher, weighed down by miners
RBA confident inflation is converging back to target

image.altText: Jordan Thompson sits on his haunches

props.synopsis: Tennis players are playing more often, in more locations around the world than ever before. This "ridiculous" schedule is looming as the sport's biggest threat.

title.children: 'Ridiculous' schedules branded by tennis stars as 'joke' and 'disaster'

image.altText: people walk in front of the angel of the north statue, the ground is covered in snow

props.synopsis: With the weather set to stay inclement on Sunday in the UK, there are concerns that many rural communities, particularly in the north of England, could be cut off.

title.children: Heavy snow causes widespread disruption across England and Europe

image.altText: Hideki Matsuyama pumping his fist on the golf course

props.synopsis: Hideki Matsuyama breaks Cameron Smith's PGA Tour 72-hole scoring record, winning The Sentry tournament in Hawaii at 35 under par.

title.children: Matsuyama breaks Cam Smith's PGA Tour scoring record

image.altText: A man wearing PPE working on a piece of cooling equipment.

props.synopsis: A quarter of electricity generated in Australia goes towards refrigeration and air conditioning, but are there enough qualified tradies to keep us cool this summer?

title.children: 'Throwaway mentality' threatening the life span of Aussie aircons

image.altText: Woman lying in curled up position on couch.

props.synopsis: The researchers hope their project can be used to build a profile of endometriosis sufferers.

title.children: No 'cure' but research could improve life for endometriosis patients

image.altText: The TikTok effect on Antarctica

props.synopsis: Academics say the frivolous nature of some TikTok videos is creating perceptions, and potentially behaviours, that are sometimes at odds with the values of the Antarctic Treaty system.

title.children: Concern 'frivolous' TikToks in Antarctica could drive unwanted behaviour

image.altText: A young woman with short brown hair smiling at the camera holding up an old style flip phone.

props.synopsis: You've had a break from social media over the holidays, but what about a more permanent reset of your relationship with your devices? These digital minimalists did just that.

title.children: 'Digital minimalists' weaning themselves from apps, but that's not easy

image.altText: The Vivienne Drag Queen wearing a blue shimmery dress with their leg up on a chair and a blonde/grey hair do

props.synopsis: The star, who previously won RuPaul's Drag Race UK in 2019, passed away over the weekend their publicist confirmed in a statement on social media.

title.children: The Vivienne, winner of RuPaul's Drag Race UK, dies aged 32

image.altText: An aerial shot of the inner-city Perth suburb of Mount Hawthorn

props.synopsis: Will this be the year mortgage borrowers finally get some interest rate relief? That's certainly what many are hoping and forecasting. Here's what you can expect, when, and what it could mean for your mortgage.

title.children: The RBA is expected to cut interest rates this year. Here's what to watch

image.altText: A safety ring on a beach which people can throw if people need assistance.

props.synopsis: A 40-year-old Perth woman has died after being swept off rocks at Salmon Beach near Esperance on Western Australia's south coast.

title.children: Drowning near Esperance brings summer's national toll to 42

image.altText: A child walks at childcare.

props.synopsis: Sydney mother Tasmia Rahman says she is struggling to find her five-month-old son a place in childcare and is concerned her family might have to wait as long as two years on a single income until they find a place.

title.children: Sydney families under budget pressure because of childcare deserts

image.altText: Batgirl stands solemnly by a stone pillar, casting a shadow onto it.

props.synopsis: Some movies are destined for greatness. But others are abandoned, lost or otherwise destined never to grace our screens.

title.children: Even movies made by big stars get 'lost'. Here are some of the best
